sentences.en: After paying all the expenses, there is a balance of fifty yuan.
Another five or six yuan will probably be enough.
sentences.cn: 再有那么五六元钱就够了.

sentences.en: For most events, tickets cost one, two or three yuan.
sentences.cn: 对于多数比赛项目而言，门票要1元、2元或3元。

sentences.en: Her income is in the order of 9000 yuan a year.
My salary has been increased to one thousand yuan.
Our net earnings were , clear of all expenses, about 200 yuan.
sentences.cn: 除去所有开支, 我们净赚200元.

sentences.en: The charge varies from 5 yuan to 10 yuan.
The cost of the building amounts to 10000 yuan.
sentences.cn: 这屋的造价合计一万元.

sentences.en: The date of birth and death of Qu Yuan is unknown.
The goods are valued in gross profit at 20,000 yuan.
sentences.cn: 这批商品的毛利估计为两万元.

sentences.en: The intrinsic worth of the pen is 30 yuan.
sentences.cn: 这支钢笔本身价值是30元.

sentences.en: The invaders wantonly set fire to Yuan Ming Yuan.
sentences.cn: 侵略者恣意妄为,把圆明园付之一炬.

sentences.en: The project was estimated to have cost 570000 yuan.
sentences.cn: 估计这项工程花费了57万元.

sentences.en: The publisher upped the ante for the biography by offering 1000 yuan.
sentences.cn: 这家出版社提高了这部传记的预约稿酬,愿比其竞争对手多付1000元.

sentences.en: The yearly rental of her house is 2400 yuan.
The Yuan Dynasty established its capital in Dadu, now Beijing.
sentences.cn: 元代建都于大都, 即今之北京.

phrases.tran_cn: 袁世凯（1859-1916，中国北洋军阀首领）

trans.tran_en: The yuan is the unit of money used in the People's Republic of China
